name: sunflower scrunchie
notes:
who doesn't love a cute scrunchie? this will make such a sweet gift to give to your friends and family!

this pattern is perfect for beginners who know the basic crochet stitches. it is very quick to make and perfect for beginners wanting some practice to perfect their crochet skills.

for this scrunchie i used marvel 8ply yarn which i sourced from spotlight, but you can use any yarn you’d like. scrunchies are the perfect project for using scrap yarns too! i would recommend acrylic yarn as it is durable, cheap and widely available in many different colours.

if you need any help with this pattern please feel free to contact me, and don’t forget to tag me in your projects you’ve made with my patterns!

materials needed

1 ball 8ply marvel yarn – brown (hawthorn)
1 ball 8ply marvel yarn – yellow (gold)
4mm crochet hook
hair tie
sewing needle
scissors
gauge & finished size

the gauge & finished size is not relevant for this project as it depends on the size of your hair tie.

terminology & stitches used

st/sts - stitch/stitches
ch - chain
hdc - half double crochet
dc - double crochet
sl st - slip stitch
picot - ch3, sl st in 3rd ch from hook
